title: What are your favorite Twenty One Pilots lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a few. In no specific order, 1. Kitchen Sink, “They don’t know you, and neither do I” This line doesn’t seem to hit many people, as it could be considered one of the tamer lines in this song, but I love it. So many of the songs under this genre of music and lyric strain to try and sound like they knew exactly what the listener is facing, but this line turns that concept around. The fact is, they don’t know. 2. Holding On To You, “Tie a noose around your mind/Loose enough to breath fine and tie it/To a tree tell it you belong to me/This ain’t a noose this is a leash, and I’ve got news for you, you must obey me” That is admittedly quite a few lines, but the way they tie together this line is so good. When your mind is wandering to such dark places, the concept of taking something as violent as a noose and using it as a leash is such a powerful one. This line hits hard on a lot of levels, for people who are suicidal, those who have anxiety, depression, or other conditions. 3. Migraine, “I am not as fine as I seem/Pardon me for yelling and telling you green gardens/Are not what’s growing in my psyche” I personally have a lot of anxiety, and one of the habits I’ve picked up is compulsive apologizing, for many things, but especially complaining. A line like this that put that feeling so nicely, along with the somewhat theatrical delivery drove this line (and this song) into being an all time favorite. 4. Car Radio, “I’m forced to deal with what I feel/there is not distraction to mask what is real” I don’t have words to put that will encapsulate why I love this line so much. I know I sound really dramatic, and that’s because I am, but this line was what made me become a fan of this band. It’s raw, and emotional, and real. 5. March To The Sea, “No one looks up anymore/Because you might get a raindrop in your eye/And heaven forbid they see you cry” I actually didn’t hear this song until about two months ago, which is unfortunate because it’s definitely one of their better songs in my opinion. The themes of the song in general are really powerful, and kind of tune well to how I think, as well as having an amazing sound. But it’s this line in particular that drove me to this song. In all honesty, I don’t know why I like this one so much, it just makes sense. That’s all.

“Sometimes, quiet is violent”- Car Radio“Our brains are sick, but that’s ok”- Fake You Out“Sometimes to stay alive you gotta kill your mind”- Migraine“Honesty, we’re probably more suicidal than ever now”-Isle of Flightless Birds“We’re broken people”- Screen“MY CHALUPAAA” and “Take that it’ll make you fat, we got the stuff that make yo booty go..” -TB Saga“I am not as fine as I seem”-Migraine“He can’t fall down anymore ’cause he’s already on the floor”-Drown“Stay alive, stay alive for me”-Truce“I scream you scream we all scream cause we’re terrified of whats around the corner” -Forest“You reached in the back and buckled up your heart”-A Car, a Torch, a Death“The demon sat there waiting on her porch. It was a little dark so he held a makeshift torch. And when my car was far out of sight, he crept in her room, and stayed there for the night”- A Car, a Torch, a Death“I’ll look left and right sometimes, but I’ll fall in line”-March to the Sea“And no one looks up anymore, ’cause you might get a raindrop in your eye, and heaven forbid they see you cry”-March to the Sea“Do me a favor and try to ignore as you watch him fall through a blatant trapdoor”-Trapdoor“Look in the mirror and ask your soul if you’re alright”-Before You Start Your Day“He wakes up early today, throws on a mask that will alter his face”-Trapdoor“Nobody knows he’s alive”- Trapdoor“When using Pokémon cards please do not use the holographicsThats all i can think of right now (I know some of these are from No Phun Intended, which technically isn’t twenty øne piløts, but whatever)
